metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2294 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 103.0.5060.114 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2294` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.36.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.6-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.36.6-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.6-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.6-1').
